definition:
Let $R$ be a ring, and let $I$ be an ideal of $R$. We say that $I$ is a
[*left (right) primitive ideal*]{} if there exists a simple left (right)
$R$-module $X$ such that $I$ is the annihilator of $X$ in $R$.

We say that $R$ is a [*left (right) primitive ring*]{} if the zero ideal
is a left (right) primitive ideal of $R$.

Note that $I$ is a left (right) primitive ideal if and only if $R/I$ is
a left (right) primitive ring.
